title: [CLIENT] Bilgewater event act I is not updating after meeting the requirements
body:
So tonight I just attempted to do the first part of the Bilgewater event.

I chose TF. I then proceed to do 3 ARAM in order to meet the requirements.

Then I go to the progress tab again. After waiting 2 minutes (like written just below), nothing happens. Waiting several more minutes, I then decide to close the client and go open it again.

Now, it asked me AGAIN to choose between Graves and TF. Does that mean I need to start over? Seems like a bug to me.

replies.body:
Hey Yfrappefort. 

This is something like a bug. Sometimes, even though the mission says it's started, it fails to start :( so you will have to choose it again.

If you could choose it again and let us know if you have problems, that would be great. If you are still unable to "make a choice", we can help out with that on the back end.

Sorry for the inconvenience. I know it's a pain :(

no, i came to post about this myself and there are other issues aside this. (i havnt experienced that bug myself)

i chose the TF story. it said aram gold and assists on any matchmade game.... so i played aram. 

the gold was tracked but my assists wernt. so i played black market... in black market the gold counted toward my aram gold achievement and  the assists achieve worked.

Hey Maikokk,

You have to complete the objectives in order, so if you have not gained the full amount of gold, you cannot get assists (which is likely why your assists in ARAM did not count).

For the gold being tracked in Black Market Brawlers, are you sure you did not hit the gold achievement before starting that game? Because if you had not earned the gold, you should not have been able to get assists in the Black Market Brawler's game you played.
its possible that i earned the gold before my brawlers game started and it didn't update till before the game ended :) TY

Of course <3

If you have any more problems, let me know and I can try and help!
It happened to me too.  I'm glad I'm not the only one.  In my case, it didn't track ANYTHING, then made me re-choose when I logged back in.
